content.question: ​The first term of a geometric sequence is <math alttext="2 over 3"><semantics><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. The next three terms are <math alttext="1 half"><semantics><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="3 over 8"><semantics><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="9 over 32"><semantics><mfrac><mn>9</mn><mn>32</mn></mfrac><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. What is the tenth term of the sequence?

topic.text: 2.1: Change in Arithmetic and Geometric Sequences

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
